title: The Ides of March
subtle:
Historical (fiction), 2,129 words, Level Z2 (Grade 5+), Lexile 930L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     Z and Z1
description: The Ides of March tells the story of the assassination of Julius Caesar by a group of conspirators in 44 BC. Students will be engaged with this riveting story and the accompanying detailed illustrations. This book can also be used to teach students how to identify narrative point of view as well as to retell the events of a story in the correct sequence. The book and lesson are also available for levels Z and Z1.
